title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #836: Intersecting 3-Chromatic Hypergraphs**

Let G be an r-uniform hypergraph with chromatic number 3 where any two edges intersect.

**Q1:** Must G have O(r²) vertices? **NO** - Alon's counterexample has ~4^r/√r

**Q2:** Must two edges meet in ≫r vertices? **PARTIAL** - Erdős-Lovász proved ≫r/log r

**Status:** SOLVED

title: Hypergraph
content:
**Hypergraph Structure:**

A hypergraph is a collection of edges (subsets) on a vertex set.

```lean
structure Hypergraph (V : Type*) where
  edges : Set (Set V)
```

Unlike graphs, edges can have more than 2 vertices.

title: r-Uniform
content:
**r-Uniform Hypergraph:**

All edges have exactly r vertices.

```lean
def IsUniform (H : Hypergraph V) (r : ℕ) : Prop :=
  ∀ e ∈ H.edges, (Set.toFinite e).toFinset.card = r
```

title: Intersecting
content:
**Intersecting Hypergraph:**

Any two edges share at least one vertex.

```lean
def IsIntersecting (H : Hypergraph V) : Prop :=
  ∀ e₁ ∈ H.edges, ∀ e₂ ∈ H.edges, (e₁ ∩ e₂).Nonempty
```

title: 3-Chromatic
content:
**3-Chromatic Hypergraph:**

Can be properly 3-coloured (no monochromatic edge) but not 2-coloured.

```lean
def IsThreeChromatic {V : Type*} (H : Hypergraph V) : Prop :=
  (∃ c : V → Fin 3, IsProperColouring H 3 c) ∧
  ¬(∃ c : V → Fin 2, IsProperColouring H 2 c)
```

title: Question 1
content:
**Question 1: O(r²) Vertex Bound**

Does every r-uniform, intersecting, 3-chromatic hypergraph have O(r²) vertices?

**ANSWER: NO**

Alon's counterexample disproves this conjecture.

title: question1_false
content:
**Question 1 is FALSE:**

```lean
axiom question1_false : ¬Question1
```

Alon provided a counterexample with exponentially many vertices.

title: Alon's Construction
content:
**Alon's Counterexample:**

**Vertices:**
- X: set of size 2r-2
- Y: all partitions of X into two equal parts (size C(2r-2,r-1)/2)

**Edges:**
- All r-subsets of X
- (r-1)-subsets of X with corresponding partition element from Y

**Result:** ~4^r/√r vertices, exponentially larger than r².

title: Erdős-Lovász Bound
content:
**Erdős-Lovász (1975):**

Two edges must meet in ≫ r/log r vertices.

```lean
def ErdosLovaszBound (r : ℕ) : ℝ := r / Real.log r
```

This is the best known lower bound. Whether it can be improved to r is open.

title: Fano Plane
content:
**The Fano Plane:**

- Projective plane of order 2
- 7 points, 7 lines (edges)
- Each line has 3 points (3-uniform)
- 3-chromatic and intersecting

**Key property:** No two lines share 2 = r-1 points; any two lines share exactly 1 point.

title: Chromatic Constraint
content:
**Chromatic Number Matters:**

- 2-chromatic + intersecting ⟹ star (all edges share one vertex)
- 3-chromatic allows much more complex structure

This is why 3-chromatic hypergraphs can have exponentially many vertices.

title: r = 3 Case
content:
**Alon for r = 3:**

X has 2·3-2 = 4 elements.
Y has C(4,2)/2 = 3 elements.
Total: 7 vertices.

This matches the Fano plane!

title: erdos_836_summary
content:
**Complete Summary:**

**Q1:** Must G have O(r²) vertices?
- **NO** - Alon's counterexample has ~4^r/√r

**Q2:** Must two edges meet in ≫r vertices?
- **PARTIAL** - Erdős-Lovász proved ≫r/log r
- Open whether this is optimal

**KEY EXAMPLES:**
- Fano plane: extremal for r-1 intersection
- Alon: exponential vertex count
